properties.title: Gallia
properties.description: The ancient region known to the Romans as "Gallia" (Gaul). Famously described by Caesar as the territory of the ancient Celts (Celtae), whom the Romans called Gauls (Galli in Latin).

properties.title: Caria
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 101 M4 Caria

properties.title: Margiana/Margush/Merv
properties.description: Margiana/Margush/Merv (Persian: مرو), once the Achaemenid Satrapy of Margiana, is a region of ancient Persia.

properties.title: Susa/Seleucia ad Eulaeum
properties.description: An ancient city of the Elamite, Persian, and Parthian empires of Iran. Located at modern Shush, Susa was inscribed on the UNESCO World Heritage List in 2015.

properties.title: Ancient Egypt (region)
properties.description: The ancient kingdom(s) and region of Egypt as understood by the Egyptians themselves, their neighbors, and their successors. Individual administrative districts, provinces, nomes, and the like have separate place resources in Pleiades.

properties.title: Paphlagonia
properties.description: The Roman province as defined in the Barrington Atlas (BAtlas 100 N3 Paphlagonia)

properties.title: Asia
properties.description: The Roman province of Asia, located on the eastern coast of the Aegean Sea. The region was bequeathed to the Roman Republic by Attalus III of Pergamum in 133 BCE. It was divided into seven smaller provinces by Diocletian in the 4th century CE.

properties.title: Macedonia (Roman province)
properties.description: A province of the Roman empire at the death of Trajan (117 CE).

properties.title: Syria (Roman imperial province)
properties.description: The Roman imperial province of Syria.

properties.title: Persis/Pars
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 94 B3 Persis/Pars

properties.title: ‘Abone’
properties.description: ‘Abone’ or Abonae was a Roman port located on the Avon (Abona) river, now Sea Mill, Bristol, Great Britain.

properties.title: Amathous
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 72 C3 Amathous

properties.title: Cyprus (island)
properties.description: Third largest island in the Mediterranean Sea.

properties.title: Karpasia
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 72 E1 Karpasia

properties.title: Keryn(e)ia/Keraunia
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 72 C2 Keryn(e)ia/Keraunia

properties.title: (Palai)Paphos
properties.description: Located on Cyprus, Paphos has been inhabited since the Neolithic period and was an important cult center of Aphrodite.

properties.title: Marion
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 72 A2 Marion

properties.title: Ammon
properties.description: The Siwa Oasis was, in antiquity, site of the oracular temple of Amun (Zeus Ammon).

properties.title: Libya
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: None

properties.title: Marmaridai
properties.description: An ancient people of Libya.

properties.title: Lapethos
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 72 unlocated Lapethos fl.

properties.title: Salaminiae
properties.description: An ancient island or island group, attested by literary or documentary sources, whose precise location cannot be determined today

properties.title: Memphis
properties.description: A city and capital of Ancient Egypt that remained an important center for most of Egyptian history.

properties.title: Arsinoites/Krokodeilopolites Nomos
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 75 D2 Arsinoites/Krokodeilopolites Nomos

properties.title: Ionian League
properties.description: An Ancient Greek confederation originally formed in the sixth century BCE by twelve Ionian cities, with religious festivals celebrated at Panionia.

properties.title: Alexandria
properties.description: The ancient port city in Egypt's Nile Delta, founded by Alexander the Great in 332/331 BCE.

properties.title: Pelusium
properties.description: Pelusium was a fortified ancient city located at the mouth of the eastern-most branch of the Nile river. Its ruins, now land-locked and located approximately 30km southeast of Port Said, are known as Tell Farama.

properties.title: Penkalas (river)
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 62 C3 Penkalas fl.

properties.title: Agdistis, T.
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 62 E3 Agdistis, T.

properties.title: Pessinous/Iustinianoupolis
properties.description: An ancient city of Asia Minor, today Ballıhisar in Turkey.

properties.title: Tyrus/Col. Septimia Severa
properties.description: The ancient city of Tyre (modern es-Sur on the coast of Lebanon). A UNESCO World Heritage Site, in part because of its "important archaeological remains, mainly from Roman times."

properties.title: Phoenice (region)
properties.description: Ancient Phoenicia.

properties.title: Sidon/Col. Aurelia Pia
properties.description: Sidon/Col. Aurelia Pia is an ancient maritime city and Phoenician metropolis

properties.title: Ancyra
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 63 B1 Ancyra

properties.title: Mallos/Antiochia ad Pyramum
properties.description: Mallos/Antiochia ad Pyramum was an ancient coastal city of Cilicia.

properties.title: Soloi/Pompeiopolis
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 66 F3 Soloi/Pompeiopolis

properties.title: Pamphylia (region)
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 65 E4 Pamphylia

properties.title: Patara (mountain)
properties.description: Eren Tepe.

properties.title: Phaselis
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 65 E4 Phaselis

properties.title: Side
properties.description: An ancient settlement on the southern coast of Asia Minor (modern Selimiye in Turkey).

properties.title: Termessos
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 65 D4 Termessos

properties.title: Laodicea ad Lycum/Diospolis/Roas
properties.description: "Laodicea on the Lycus": an ancient settlement located near the modern village of Eskihisar (Eski Hissar) in Denizli Province, Turkey.

properties.title: Lycia
properties.description: Lycia was a region of southwestern Asia Minor.

properties.title: Caunus
properties.description: An ancient city of Caria in southwest Asia Minor.

properties.title: Eurymedon (river)
properties.description: Eurymedon fl. (Köprüçay River)

properties.title: Daidala
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 65 A4 Daidala

properties.title: Cilicia
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 64 B4 Cilicia

properties.title: Antiochia/Theoupolis
properties.description: A city founded ca. 300 BC by Seleucus I Nicator, a successor of Alexander the Great. Antioch was a great trading center and numbered as one of the four cities of the Syrian tetrapolis. Justinian I renamed the city 'Theoupolis' in the sixth century AD.

properties.title: Italia
properties.description: The Italian peninsula extending northward to the Alps as recognized by the Romans.

properties.title: Ionium Mare
properties.description: The Ionian Sea, located south of the Adriatic Sea, is an elongated embayment of the Mediterranean Sea.

properties.title: Lykia
properties.description: The Late antique province of Lykia (BAtlas 102 E4 no. 28)

properties.title: Pamphylia
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 102 F4 no. 27 (Pamphylia)

properties.title: Hellas
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 102 D4 no. 10 (Hellas)

properties.title: Europe
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 102 E3 no. 1 (Europe)

properties.title: Thrake
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 102 E3 no. 3 (Thrake)

properties.title: Munychia
properties.description: A hill in the Piraeus and the site of extensive fortifications in the Classical and Hellenistic periods.

properties.title: The "Hochtor Sanctuary"
properties.description: A Celto-Roman sanctuary situated at an ancient high-mountain pass in the eastern Alps near Grossglockner, excavated beginning in the 1990s. Its ancient name is unknown.

properties.title: Massalia/Massilia
properties.description: Massalia/Massilia (modern Marseille, France) was founded by Phocaean Greeks ca. 600 B.C. as a trading outpost. Massalia, in turn, established its own secondary colonies. During the Punic Wars Massalia was allied to Rome and, following the sacking of Carthage in 146 B.C., the settlement enjoyed increased economic vitality.

properties.title: Thessalia
properties.description: Thessalia (Thessaly) was a region of ancient Greece.

properties.title: Pontus Euxinus
properties.description: The Black Sea.

properties.title: Asia Minor
properties.description: An ancient region, coincident with a peninsula of the continent of Asia. It is bounded on the south by the Mediterranean Sea, on the west by the Aegean Sea, and on the north by the Black Sea. Today it is part of the territory of the modern country of Turkey.

properties.title: Santorini Archipelago
properties.description: The islands of the Santorini archipelago, inhabited until the Late Bronze Age, were formed by modern and historic volcanism.

properties.title: Colchis/Lazike
properties.description: Colchis/Lazike was an ancient region located to the east of the Black Sea.

properties.title: Heraclea
properties.description: An ancient settlement on the Black Sea coast of Asia Minor at modern Karadeniz Ereğli in Turkey. It is often referred to as Heraclea Pontica (or Heraclea in Pontus) to distinguish it from other cities with the same name.

properties.title: Sinope
properties.description: Sinope (modern Sinop, Turkey) on the Black Sea has been a major port since the time of the Hittites.

properties.title: Themiskyra
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 87 B3 Themiskyra

properties.title: Thermodon (river)
properties.description: The Terme River or Terme Çayı.

properties.title: Phasis (river)
properties.description: Phasis fl. (Rioni river (Georgian: რიონი)) is a major river of western Georgia.

properties.title: Sys (river)
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 50 C4 Sys fl.

properties.title: Poteidaia/Kassandreia
properties.description: Poteidaia/Kassandreia was a Greek colony founded ca. 600 BC by Corinthians on the peninsula of Pallene in western Chalcidice. The site received a Roman colony in 43 B.C. and in 30 B.C. Augustus settled veterans there, renaming it as Colonia Iulia Augusta Cassandrensis.

properties.title: Leibethra
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 50 C4 Leibethra

properties.title: Pella
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 50 C3 Pella (1)

properties.title: Macedonia (region)
properties.description: The region of ancient Macedonia in the Balkan peninsula. The boundaries of the region have shifted significantly over time, and remain controversial.

properties.title: Pallene/Phlegra
properties.description: Pallene/Phlegra is the westernmost of the three headlands of Chalcidice that project into the Aegean Sea.

properties.title: Olympos (mountain in Greece)
properties.description: Olympus is the highest mountain in Greece, located in the Olympus Range. In Greek mythology, it is the home of the Olympian gods.

properties.title: Olynthos
properties.description: Olynthos was an ancient city of the Chalcidice, founded in the seventh century B.C. and destroyed in 348 B.C. by the forces of Philip II of Macedon.

properties.title: Paionia
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 50 A1 Paionia

properties.title: Pieria
properties.description: Originally the territory of the Pieres, later incoporated into Macedonia

properties.title: Mygdonia
properties.description: Mygdonia was a region of ancient Macedonia.

properties.title: Axios (river)
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 50 A1 Axios fl.

properties.title: Charakoma
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 50 C3 Charakoma

properties.title: Aigeai
properties.description: An ancient settlement most noted for the discovery, in 1977, of Macedonian royal tombs at the site.

properties.title: Aphytis
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 50 D4 Aphytis

properties.title: Dion
properties.description: Dion was a settlement of Pieria located just south of Macedonia and held, traditionally, as the place of Orpheus' death and burial.

properties.title: Chalcidice
properties.description: A peninsula in northern Greece. It was hotly contested between Athens and Sparta during the Peloponnesian War, and was later the site of important gold mines under Philip II of Macedon.

properties.title: Sardinia (island)
properties.description: The second largest island in the Mediterranean Sea

properties.title: Corsica/Kyrnos (island)
properties.description: The island of Corsica, in the Mediterranean Sea.

properties.title: Akragas (river)
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 47 D4 Akragas fl.

properties.title: Pachynos (river)
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 47 G5 Pachynos fl.

properties.title: Segesta/Egesta
properties.description: A center of the Elymian people in northwestern Sicily.

properties.title: Selinous/Lanaricus (river)
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 47 B3 Selinous/Lanaricus fl.

properties.title: Sicilia (island)
properties.description: Sicily is the largest island in the Mediterranean Sea and has been the site of human habitation since ca. 8,000 BC. In historical terms Sicily has seen important settlement activity connected to numerous culture groups - Punic, Carthaginian, Greek, Roman, Vandalic, Ostrogothic, Byzantine, Arabic, and Norman.

properties.title: Motya
properties.description: A small island in the Stagnone Lagoon of western Sicily, Motya has evidence for quite ancient settlement, including a significant Punic phase. The settlement on the island was destroyed by Syracuse in 379 BC. At one point the island was connected to the mainland via a causeway.

properties.title: Naxos (settlement)
properties.description: Naxos was the earliest Greek settlement in Sicily, according to Thucydides who places its foundation in 734 BC.

properties.title: Hybla Heraia
properties.description: Hybla Heraia (modern Ragusa) was an indigenous center of ancient Sicily that came into contact with Greek and, later, Roman and Byzantine cultures.

properties.title: Himera
properties.description: A colony on the north shore of Sicily founded in 649/8 BC by the Myletidai.

properties.title: Leontini
properties.description: A Greek colonial city founded by Naxians in 729 B.C., Leontini was reduced by Hippocrates of Gela in 498 B.C. Following the Sicilian Expedition, the city became subject to Syracuse. In Roman times it may have been of little importance and was destroyed by the Saracens in A.D. 848.

properties.title: Gela
properties.description: A Greek colony of Sicily founded by Rhodians and Cretans ca. 688 B.C. The oikists were the Rhodian Antiphemos and the Cretan Entimos.

properties.title: Inykon?
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 47 B2 Inykon?

properties.title: Lipara (settlement)
properties.description: A Greek colony and long-time settlement on the island of the same name, located to the north of Sicily in the Tyrrhenian Sea. Modern Lipari.

properties.title: Eryx
properties.description: An ancient, indigenous settlement of western Sicily, likely inhabited by the Elymians.

properties.title: Hybla Gereatis
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 47 F3 Hybla Gereatis

properties.title: Katane/Catina
properties.description: The colonial city of Katane (modern Catania) was founded by Chalcidian Greeks sometime after the foundation of Leontini in 730 B.C.

properties.title: Zancle/Messana
properties.description: Zancle was founded as Greek colony in the eighth century B.C.

properties.title: Syracusae/Syrakousai
properties.description: An important ancient city on the island of Sicily.

properties.title: Inessa/Aitna
properties.description: An ancient settlement, attested by literary or documentary sources, whose precise location cannot be determined today

properties.title: Skamandros
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 47 unlocated Skamandros fl.

properties.title: Etruria/Tuscia (region)
properties.description: Etruria/Tuscia was an ancient region of Central Italy inhabited by the Etruscans.

properties.title: Antigoneia
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 49 C3 Antigoneia

properties.title: Chaonia
properties.description: A district of Epirus inhabited by the Chaonians, a Greek tribe.

properties.title: Apollonia
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 49 B3 Apollonia

properties.title: Chimaira
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 49 B3 Chimaira

properties.title: Ceraunii (mountain)
properties.description: Cikes Mts.

properties.title: Aous (river)
properties.description: A river that flows from the Pindus mountains to the Adriatic Sea; the modern Vjosë or Aoös.

properties.title: Illyrii
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 49 B2 Illyrii

properties.title: Dyrr(h)achium/Epidamnos
properties.description: A city founded in 627 B.C. by colonists from Corinth and Kerkyra.

properties.title: Encheleioi
properties.description: An ancient people, tribe, or cultural group. Located: N Lake Ohrid MAC.

properties.title: Messapii
properties.description: The Messapii were an ancient Indo-European people occupying the Salento peninsula in southeast Italy.

properties.title: Iapyges
properties.description: The Iapyges were a pre-Roman, Indo-European people that inhabited Apulia in southeastern Italy.

properties.title: Metapontum
properties.description: An important city of Magna Graecia, Metapontum was located on the Gulf of Tarentum. The Achaeans were responsible for its foundation, perhaps as early as the eighth century B.C.

properties.title: Taras/Tarentum/Neptunia
properties.description: A Greek colonial city founded in 706 B.C.

properties.title: Brundisium/Brentesion
properties.description: A Greek and Roman port, terminus of the Via Appia.

properties.title: Pontiae (islands)
properties.description: An archipelago in the Tyrrhenian Sea off the west coast of Italy.

properties.title: Capua
properties.description: An important ancient city of Campania with Villanovan and Etruscan origins.

properties.title: Cumae/Kyme (Campanian)
properties.description: An ancient settlement of Campania, Cumae was the first Greek colony established on the Italian mainland in the eighth century BC.

properties.title: Roma
properties.description: The capital of the Roman Republic and Empire.

properties.title: Sybaris/Thurii/Copia
properties.description: Sybaris was an ancient city of Magna Graecia founded as an Achaean colony as early as 720 B.C. on a plain drained by both the Crati and Sybaris rivers.

properties.title: Rhegion/Regium
properties.description: A site with settlement origins in the Bronze and Iron ages, Rhegion was eventually colonized by Chalcis in either 730 or 743 BC.

properties.title: Sybaris
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 46 E2 Sybaris

properties.title: Temesa/Tempsa
properties.description: An ancient city located on the west coast of Bruttium, just north of the Gulf of Hipponium.

properties.title: Kaulonia
properties.description: Kaulonia is an Achaean colony of Magna Graecia founded in the eighth or seventh century BC.

properties.title: Lokroi Epizephyrioi
properties.description: Locri is a town and comune in the province of Reggio Calabria, Calabria, in southern Italy. Epizephyrian Locris was founded ca. 680 BC near modern Capo Zefirio, by the Locrians, apparently under the Opuntii (East Locrians) from the city of Opus, but also including Ozolae (West Locrians) and Lacedaemonians.

properties.title: Temple of Hera Lacinia
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 46 F3 Hera, T.

properties.title: Croto(n)
properties.description: An Achaean colony in Magna Graecia established in 710 BC by the oikist Myscellus from the city of Rhypes in the Peloponnese.

properties.title: Padus/Eridanus (river)
properties.description: The Po river of northern Italy flows from the Cottian Alps (Alpes Cottiae) to the Adriatic Sea. It is the longest of Italy's rivers.

properties.title: Cyrene
properties.description: An ancient Greek city founded in eastern Libya ca. 630 B.C., Cyrene later became part of the Roman empire (ca. 74 B.C.). The site was added to the UNESCO World Heritage List in 1982.

properties.title: Carthago
properties.description: The ancient city of Carthage, located in modern Tunis (Tunisia). Carthage engaged the Roman state in a series of wars conventionally referred to as the Punic Wars by scholars.

properties.title: Temple of Aphrodite Euploia
properties.description: The temple of Aphrodite Euploia is a tholos constructed in the fourth century BC in Knidos, a coastal city on the Datça Peninsula. It was built to house Praxiteles' famous nude statue of Aphrodite.

properties.title: Castalian spring
properties.description: A spring in the ravine between the Phaedriades cliffs (on the lower southern slope of Mt. Parnassos) at Delphi.

properties.title: Odrysae (region)
properties.description: The Odrysian kingdom was formed from the union of more than 40 Thracian tribes. It endured from the fifth century B.C. to the first century A.D. and was centered in modern-day Bulgaria, as well as in parts of Romania and Greece.

properties.title: Danuvius/Istros/Hister (river)
properties.description: The Danube river.

properties.title: Gadeira/Gades/Col. Augusta Gaditana
properties.description: Gadeira/Gades/Col. Augusta Gaditana (modern Cadiz, Spain) is an ancient city of Spain and one of the oldest continuously occupied cities of Europe. Its origins may be Phoenician (Gadir (Phoenician: גדר)).

properties.title: Priene/‘Lince’?
properties.description: Priene/‘Lince’? was an ancient Greek city of Ionia on an escarpment of Mycale Mons.

properties.title: Samos
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 61 D2 Samos

properties.title: Syrna
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 61 G4 Syrna

properties.title: Sounion Pr.
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 61 A3 Sounion Pr.

properties.title: Rheneia (settlement)
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 61 A3 Rheneia

properties.title: Thera
properties.description: An ancient settlement located atop the modern Messavouno mountain on the island that shared its name in antiquity (modern Thira/Santorini).

properties.title: Kos
properties.description: An ancient city, located on the Aegean island of the same name.

properties.title: Latmos (mountain)
properties.description: Latmos M. (Beşparmak Mountains) run east-west along the north shore of the former Latmian Gulf on the coast of Caria.

properties.title: Lebedos/Ptolemais
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 61 D1 Lebedos/Ptolemais

properties.title: Magnesia ad Maeandrum/Leukophrys
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 61 F2 Magnesia ad Maeandrum/Leukophrys

properties.title: Klaros
properties.description: The site of a temple of Apollo administered by Colophonians and active from the seventh century B.C. to the fourth century A.D.

properties.title: Maeander (river)
properties.description: The Maeander (modern Büyük Menderes River) is a river of Caria in southwestern Asia Minor.

properties.title: Miletus
properties.description: A major ancient city in Caria.

properties.title: Keramos
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 61 F3 Keramos

properties.title: Lade (island)
properties.description: Formerly an island northwest of Miletus.

properties.title: Halicarnassus/Halikarnassos
properties.description: An ancient city in Caria, now known as Bodrum in Turkey.

properties.title: Heraclea ad Latmum/Pleistarcheia
properties.description: A town of Caria located 25 km west of Miletos on the Ionian coast, Heraclea was located on the lower slopes of Mt. Latmos. Once a part of the Delian League, the city fell to Mausolos in the fourth century B.C. and his philhellene policy accounts for its change of name.

properties.title: Ionopolitikos/Latmikos Sinus
properties.description: Ionopolitikos/Latmikos Sinus (Latmian Gulf) was a coastal body of water in Ionia that disappeared due to silting from the Maeander river.

properties.title: Ikaros (island)
properties.description: An island in the Aegean Sea (modern Ikaria), now part of the modern country of Greece.

properties.title: Ioniapolis
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 61 F3 Ioniapolis

properties.title: Hiera/Automate (island)
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 61 A5 Hiera/Automate Ins.

properties.title: Ephesus/Arsinoe(ia)
properties.description: Ephesus/Arsinoe(ia) was the most important ancient metropolis of Ionian Asia Minor.

properties.title: Imbrasos (river)
properties.description: Imbrasos fl. on the island of Samos was said to have been the birthplace of the goddess Hera.

properties.title: Ios (settlement)
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 61 A4 Ios

properties.title: Ortygia
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 61 E2 Ortygia

properties.title: Poseidon Phytalmios?, T.
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 61 A4 Poseidon Phytalmios?, T.

properties.title: Myndos
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 61 E3 Myndos

properties.title: Paros
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 61 A3 Paros

properties.title: Panormos
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 61 E2 Panormos

properties.title: Mylasa
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 61 F3 Mylasa

properties.title: Mycale (mountain)
properties.description: Samsun Dağ.

properties.title: Naxos (island)
properties.description: Naxos is the largest of the Cycladic islands and was the center of the Cycladic civilization.

properties.title: Aigiale
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 61 B4 Aigiale

properties.title: Anaia
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 61 E2 Anaia

properties.title: Caria (region)
properties.description: A historical region of western Anatolia.

properties.title: Chrysaoras (river)
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 61 G2 Chrysaoras fl.

properties.title: Astypalaia
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 61 C4 Astypalaia

properties.title: Cnidus
properties.description: Cnidus, a Greek city of ancient Caria that was part of the Dorian Hexapolis, was located at modern Burgaz in south-western Asia Minor on the modern Datça peninsula (Knidia) in Turkey. In the late fourth century, the political center of the peninsula moved from the site at Burgaz to the site at Tekir.

properties.title: Colophon
properties.description: Colophon was an Ionian city in Lydia, located ca. 13 km north of the harbour of Notion. Its ruins are located near modern Değirmendere.

properties.title: Didyma/Branchidai/Ioustinianopolis
properties.description: The ancient sanctuary of Apollo near Miletos (modern Didim, Turkey).

properties.title: Chelone Pr.
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 61 E4 Chelone Pr.

properties.title: Delos (island)
properties.description: The Aegean island of Delos, part of the Cyclades island group.

properties.title: Rhodos (island)
properties.description: The island of Rhodes has an area of some 1,400 square km and sits 18 km from the coast of Asia Minor. The island has been inhabited by humans since the Neolithic period.

properties.title: Tenos (settlement)
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 60 B4 Tenos

properties.title: Siphnos (island)
properties.description: The island of Siphnos has been inhabited since the Neolithic period and was a major center of Cycladic civilization.

properties.title: Seriphos (island)
properties.description: Seriphos is an island of the western Cyclades. The island was settled by the third millennium B.C. The island was a member of the Delian League.

properties.title: Tarra
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 60 A2 Tarra

properties.title: Achaia (region?)
properties.description: An ancient region or city quarter of western Crete, possibly associated with Polyrrenia. Its precise location is unknown.

properties.title: Strymon (river)
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 51 A2 Strymon fl.

properties.title: Stageira
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 51 B3 Stageira

properties.title: Sestos
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 51 G4 Sestos

properties.title: Thasos (settlement)
properties.description: Greeks from Paros founded a colony on Thasos in the middle of the seventh century B.C.

properties.title: Sapaike
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 51 D2 Sapaike

properties.title: Tripolis

properties.title: Oropos

properties.title: Locris Ozolia
properties.description: Locris Ozolia or Ozolian Locris was a region of Ancient Greece. The Ozolian Locrians inhabited this area that was situated on the Corinthian Gulf and was bounded to the north by Doris, to the east by Phocis, and to the west by Aetolia.

properties.title: Magnesia (region)
properties.description: A coastal region of Thessaly, including the long, narrow peninsula stretching into the Aegean on the southeast. Magnesia gives its name to the modern Greek regional unit.

properties.title: Medeon
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 55 D4 Medeon

properties.title: Ledon
properties.description: An ancient Greek settlement in Phocis, mentioned by Pausanias and abandoned by his time. Possibly to be located at modern Modi.

properties.title: Oiantheia/Euantheia?
properties.description: A town of the Ozolian Locrians, situated at the western entrance of the Crissaean Gulf.

properties.title: Opous

properties.title: Mykalessos
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 55 F4 Mykalessos

properties.title: Leuktra
properties.description: Leuktra was a settlement located in ancient Boeotia. It was located along the road leading from Thespiae to Plataea, somewhere in the vicinity of the modern town. In 371 B.C. the Thebans defeated the Spartans in a celebrated battle near the site.

properties.title: Larissa

properties.title: Myania
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 55 C4 Myania

properties.title: Maliacus Sinus
properties.description: Maliacus Sinus (Malian Gulf) is a gulf of the Aegean Sea in eastern central Greece. The gulf is located in the region of Phthiotis.

properties.title: Oeta M.
properties.description: A mountain range of southern Phthiotis and northern Phocis in Greece, Oeta is celebrated in mythology as the site of Herakles' death.

properties.title: Orchomenos/Orchomenus
properties.description: The so-called "Boeotian Orchomenos", located in the vicinity of the Byzantine church of Panaghia Skripou. The longer, modern title is used to distinguish this settlement from another Greek site with the same ancient name located in Arcadia in the Peloponnese.

properties.title: Molykreion?
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 55 B4 Molykreion?

properties.title: Oreos

properties.title: Malis

properties.title: Larymna (Boeotia)
properties.description: Located on the Gulf of Euboea, Larymna was a town of eastern Locris.

properties.title: Onchestos
properties.description: Onchestos was located northwest of Thebes and was the site of an ancient cult of Poseidon. Prior to the Macedonian period the Boeotian confederacy met here.

properties.title: Lebadeia
properties.description: Lebadeia was an ancient settlement located close to the western frontier of Boeotia.

properties.title: Naupactus
properties.description: Originally a city of the Ozolian Locrians, Naupactus eventually fell to Athens; under Macedonian rule Philip II ceded it to the Aetolians.

properties.title: Palaia Pleuron
properties.description: Original location of the ancient city of Pleuron, which was reportedly destroyed in the 3rd century BCE. There is debate concerning its location. After the destruction, a new site was selected for the city. It is known as "Nea Pleuron" (q.v.).

properties.title: Locris Epiknemidia

properties.title: Chalcis

properties.title: Daulis

properties.title: Donakon?

properties.title: Euenos (river)
properties.description: The Euenos (modern Evinos) is a river of western Greece that flows into the Gulf of Patras.

properties.title: Graia
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 55 F4 Graia

properties.title: Elateia
properties.description: Elateia was an ancient Greek city of Phocis, and numbered as the most important place in that region after Delphi.

properties.title: Cithaeron (mountain)

properties.title: Glisas

properties.title: Erochos

properties.title: Delphi

properties.title: Eleutherai

properties.title: Chaeronea
properties.description: An ancient settlement of Boeotia, Chaeronea was a subject of Orchomenus and a member of the Boeotian League. From the late fifth century BC, Chaeronea belonged to one of the 11 Boeotian districts.

properties.title: Coronea
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 55 D4 Coronea

properties.title: Doris
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 55 C3 Doris

properties.title: Dolopia

properties.title: Gyrton(e)
properties.description: An ancient city of Thessaly.

properties.title: Ainis
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 55 C3 Ainis

properties.title: Boeotia
properties.description: A region of central Greece inhabited since prehistoric times.

properties.title: Askra
properties.description: An ancient town of Boeotia known as the birthplace of Hesiod.

properties.title: Ambrossos

properties.title: Amphissa

properties.title: Artemision

properties.title: Akraiphiai

properties.title: Anthedon

properties.title: Antikyra
properties.description: Antikyra was a port city located east of Kirrha. Pausanias identifies it with the Homeric Kyparissos.

properties.title: Arne
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 55 D4 Arne

properties.title: Amphikleia
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 55 D3 Amphikleia

properties.title: Asopos (river)

properties.title: Amphiareion

properties.title: Iolkos

properties.title: Helicon (mountain)
properties.description: In Greek mythology, Helicon was the site of two springs sacred to the Muses, the Aganippe and the Hippocrene. The mountain is located near the Gulf of Corinth and rises to an elevation of 1,749 meters (5,738 ft).

properties.title: Parnassus (mountain)
properties.description: A mountain of central Greece located north of the Gulf of Corinth. In Greek mythology Parnassus was sacred to Apollo and was the home of the Muses.

properties.title: Pherai
properties.description: Pherai was an ancient city of Thessaly in the district of Pelasgiotis.

properties.title: Phocis
properties.description: A region of central ancient Greece. In ~ 356 BCE, Phocian generals seized Delphi, starting the Third Sacred War.

properties.title: Plataea
properties.description: Plataea is an ancient city of Boeotia, located south of Thebes. In 479 BC Plataea was the site of the Battle of Plataea, in which an allied Greek army defeated the Persians. Plataea was destroyed in the Peloponnesian War by Thebes and Sparta in 427 BC and rebuilt in 386 BC.

properties.title: Peneios (river)

properties.title: Pelasgiotis

properties.title: Pharsalus

properties.title: Ptoios, T.
properties.description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 55 E4 Ptoios, T.

properties.title: Tithronion
properties.description: An ancient city of Phocis in Greek, which according to Pausanias was burned by Xerxes. Modern consensus places its acropolis at an unexcavated paliokastro north of modern Ano Kalivia, just inside the southern boundary of the Kapenitsa-Vertzianou-Amfikleia protected area.

properties.title: Spercheios

properties.title: Stiris/Steiris
properties.description: An ancient settlement of eastern Phocis. The site of ancient Steiri has only ever been partly explored and defined. The city was located in an area known locally today as Paliokhori. The acropolis has been identified on a hill locally known today as Bouli, where a church or monastery of Agios Nikolaos (now ruined?) reportedly succeeded it. The site was not coincident with the modern town that has inherited the ancient name. Rather, ancient Stiris was located to the south and east of the famous monastery of Hosios Loukas, which lies between modern Steiri and modern Kyriaki (archaeological evidence for fortifications and other structures have, however, been noted both at modern Steiri and at Hosios Loukas as elsewhere in the area).

It was home to an Iron Age kingdom (q.v), and gave its name to a succession of administrative areas of the Roman empire and other states.

properties.title: Sardis/Hyde?
properties.description: Sardis was the capital of the Lydian Empire located in western Turkey. In 188 B.C. Sardis became a part of the Attalid kingdom and thus it passed with the territory of Attalus III to Rome in 133 B.C.

properties.title: Smyrna/Eurydikeia
properties.description: An ancient settlement of Asia Minor, modern Izmir in Turkey.

properties.title: Phocaea
properties.description: An ancient settlement of Asia Minor, modern Foça in Turkey.

properties.title: Pergamum
properties.description: An important ancient settlement, located at modern Bergama in Turkey. It was first described in Xenophon's Anabasis and was later used as a treasury under Lysimachus. Pergamum became the administrative capital and principal city of the Attalid kingdom and dynasty (282-133 BCE) and was briefly the first capital of the Roman province of Asia. It later was a seat of a Christian bishopric and is listed in Revelation as one of the seven churches of Asia. It was inscribed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 2014 under "Pergamon and its Multi-Layered Cultural Landscape".

properties.title: Aeolis
properties.description: Sometimes defined as covering the entrance of the Hellespont to the mouth of the Hermus river, Aeolis was region centered on the North West coast of Asia Minor and some islands, notably Lesbos. Herodotus lists the eleven ancient cities of Aeolis as Cyme, Lerisae, Neon Teichos, Temnos, Cilla, Notion, Aegiroessa, Pitane, Aegaeae, Myrina, and Gryneia. He also claims that Smyrna was once an Aeolian city, but was taken by the Ionians at an unspecified date.

properties.description: An ancient Greek city in Aeolis that lies on the mainland opposite the island of Lesbos, northeast of the town of Dikili in modern-day Turkey.

properties.title: Caicus (river)
properties.description: The modern Bakırçay river, a river of southwest Asia Minor that flows from the Temnos mountains to the Elaitic Gulf.

properties.title: Hermus (river)
properties.description: The Gediz River, the second largest of Anatolia's rivers, flows into the Aegean Sea.

properties.title: Erythrai
properties.description: Erythrai was one of the twelve Ionian cities of Asia Minor. It is located on a small peninsula that extends into the Bay of Erythrae.

properties.title: Ionia (region)

properties.title: Eresos
properties.description: An ancient settlement on the island of Lesbos (modern Skala Eresou), reputed birthplace of the poet Sappho. Strabo describes it as being built on a hill (presumably the modern Vigla) and extending down to the sea.

properties.title: Cyme
properties.description: An ancient city of Aeolis.

properties.title: Ida (mountain)
properties.description: Ida M. is a mountain of northwestern Turkey standing to 5,820 ft (1,774 m) above sea level.

properties.title: Hypaipa
properties.description: Hypaipa or Hypaepa is an ancient city of Lydia located at the foot of Mount Aipos.

properties.title: Ilium/Troia
properties.description: An ancient city of northwest Anatolia with occupation ranging from the Bronze Age to the Roman period. Troy features as the central setting of Homer's Iliad.
